comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: If the original moulding and ironwork has been preserved, it should be possible to find the exact address/location of this shop using Google Maps. I've very loosely placed it along the Quays in Waterford... (that's what's known in the trade as an unsubtle hint!)

comment.author: 39396619@N05
comment._content:
The premises above is now Jordan's Pub, 123 The Quay, Waterford.
I need to visit to find out if the ironwork is still beneath the pub advertising.
I will post a modern photo also.  The laneway at the side is still there as are the windows in the adjacent building. Now I'm really curious.

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content:
Great that the external building finish remains unchanged, even the cast iron window balconies! Same for the path flag stones. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/30687643@N00] Thanks for the link.

Strange through, there appears to be a reflection of railway lines in the window but if that's the case those lines would go directly into the river!!

Stuart.
